Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION ON PLEA OF GUILTY - IT IS RECOMMENDED TO JUDGE LAURIE SMITH CAMP that she accept the guilty pleas tendered by the defendant and that she accept the written plea agreement with the understanding that the court is not bound by the parties' stipulations, but may with the aid of the presentence report, determine the facts relevant to sentencing. And ORDER that any objection to this Report and Recommendation shall be filed with the Clerk of the Court within ten (10) business days after being served with acopy of this Report and Recommendation. Failure to timely object may constitute a waiver of any such objection. The brief in support of any objection shall be filed at the time of filing such objection. Failure to file a brief in support of any objection may be deemed an abandonment of the objection as to defendant Alonzo Wynne. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION ON PLEA OF GUILTY - IT IS RECOMMENDED TO JUDGE LAURIE SMITH CAMP that she accept the guilty pleas tendered by the defendant and that she accept the written plea agreement with the understanding that the court is not bound by the parties' stipulations, but may with the aid of the presentence report, determine the facts relevant to sentencing. And ORDER that any objection to this Report and Recommendation shall be filed with the Clerk of the Court within ten (10) business days after being served with acopy of this Report and Recommendation. Failure to timely object may constitute a waiver of any such objection. The brief in support of any objection shall be filed at the time of filing such objection. Failure to file a brief in support of any objection may be deemed an abandonment of the objection as to defendant Alonzo Wynne. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Arnett J. Bonner. The defendant pleaded guilty to counts I, VI, VII and XVI of the Superseding Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 168 months on count I and 120 months on count VI to run concurrently; supervised release, with special conditions, for a term of 5 years on count I and 3 years on count VI to run concurrently; $200 special assessment. The indictment and counts V, VIII, IX and X of the Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only. Final order of forfeiture as to Counts VII and XVI forthcoming. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Report and Recommendation 95 is overruled. The Clerk is directed to strike the Order on Sentencing Schedule 94. The change of plea hearing is continued. Both counsel and the Defendant must correct by interlineation and initial the plea agreement and plea petition. The time between today's date and the date of the change of plea hearing to be scheduled before the undersigned will be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act, as to Alonzo Wynne. The Clerk is directed to send a copy of this Memorandum and Order to the U.S. Probation Office. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (Copy forwared to U.S. Probation)( JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Report and Recommendation 95 is overruled. The Clerk is directed to strike the Order on Sentencing Schedule 94. The change of plea hearing is continued. Both counsel and the Defendant must correct by interlineation and initial the plea agreement and plea petition. The time between today's date and the date of the change of plea hearing to be scheduled before the undersigned will be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act, as to Alonzo Wynne. The Clerk is directed to send a copy of this Memorandum and Order to the U.S. Probation Office. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (Copy forwared to U.S. Probation)( JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER REGARDING FORFEITURE - The government's motion for issuance of preliminary order of criminal forfeiture 131 is denied as to the following: the Defendant, Alonzo Wynne, insofar as the motion addresses the following firearms related to the offense charged in Count II: a Glock model 30.45 caliber gun, serial number DPD954US; and a Taurus millennium model PT 111 9mm pistol, serial number TVE 89619. The government may seek administrative forfeiture of this property. Otherwise, the government's motion 131 is granted. The United States is hereby authorized to seize: the Sig Sauer semi-automatic pistol, model P229, 9mm caliber, serial number AK-11820; the Colt six-shot revolver, Python,.357 caliber, serial number V35932; the Ruger semi-automatic pistol model Mark 1,.22 caliber, serial number 13-06838; $590.00; $17,890.00; $10,000.00; and $28,895.00. The Defendants interest in the properties listed in preceding (2) properties is forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law. The forfeited properties listed in (2) are to be held by the United States in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture, in which all interests will be addressed as to defendants Arnett J. Bonner, Alonzo Wynne, and Dermaine Davis. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 Certified copy to USM) (KBJ)PRELIMINARY ORDER REGARDING FORFEITURE - The government's motion for issuance of preliminary order of criminal forfeiture 131 is denied as to the following: the Defendant, Alonzo Wynne, insofar as the motion addresses the following firearms related to the offense charged in Count II: a Glock model 30.45 caliber gun, serial number DPD954US; and a Taurus millennium model PT 111 9mm pistol, serial number TVE 89619. titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Dermaine Davis (3), Counts 1, 15-16, Defendant pleaded guilty to counts I, XV and XVI of the Superseding Indictment and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 121 months; 5 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment; Defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons no earlier than June 5, 2009 by 2:00 p.m.; Final order of forfeiture as to Counts XV and XVI forthcoming. Defendant shall forfeit the Defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: $17,890.00 and $28,895.00 in U.S. Currency as to defendant(s) Dermaine Davis. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(ADB, )

Defendant shall forfeit the Defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: $17,890.00 and $28,895.00 in U.S. Currency as to defendant(s) Dermaine Davis. titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Alonzo Wynne. Defendant pleaded guilty to counts I, IV, XI and XIV of the Superseding Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 130 months on count I and 60 months on count XI to run consecutively, followed by supervised release, with special conditions, for a term of 5 years on count I and 3 years on count XI to run concurrently, $200.00 special assessment. Counts II, III, XII and XIII of the Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only. Final order of forfeiture as to Count IV and XIV forthcoming. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Alonzo Wynne. Counts II, III, XII and XIII of the Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only. Final order of forfeiture as to Count IV and XIV forthcoming. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE)

titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Shawntel Scaife. Counts I and XV of the Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER the court has completed the initial review of the defendant's 2255 motion 196; upon initial review the court summarily dismisses the defendant's claim raised; a separate judgment will be issued denying the 2255 motion; the defendant's motion for discovery 197 is denied; the defendant's motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis 199 is denied; and the clerk is directed to mail a copy of this memorandum and order to the defendant at his last known address as to defendant Alonzo Wynne as ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (Copies mailed as directed) (SED) Civil Case 8:10-cv-00080-LSC closed.

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER the court has completed the initial review of the defendant's 2255 motion 196; upon initial review the court summarily dismisses the defendant's claim raised; a separate judgment will be issued denying the 2255 motion; the defendant's motion for discovery 197 is denied; the defendant's motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis 199 is denied; and the clerk is directed to mail a copy of this memorandum and order to the defendant at his last known address as to defendant Alonzo Wynne as ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (Copies mailed as directed) (SED) Civil Case 8:10-cv-00080-LSC closed.

titleInfo.title: USA v. Bonner
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE as to Arnett J. Bonner (1), Alonzo Wynne (2), and Dermaine Davis (3) - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture and Motion to Dismiss (Filing No. 209) is hereby sustained. Count IV of the Superseding Indictment concerning the $590.00 in United States Currency is hereby dismissed. All right, title and interest in and to the Sig Sauer semi-automatic pistol, model P229, 9mm caliber, serial number AK-11820; the Colt six-shot revolver, Python,.357 caliber, serial number V35932; the Ruger semi-automatic pistol model Mark 1,.22 caliber, serial number 13-06838; $17,890.00; $10,000.00; and $28,895.00, held by any person or entity, are hereby forever barred and foreclosed. These properties are hereby forfeited to the United States of America. The United States is directed to dispose of all the properties in accordance with law. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.
